experience.title: Enedis
experience.description: As part of the Smart Grid & Electric Mobility team at Enedis, I developed tools to support field operations on the electrical network. My responsibilities included building web applications for data management, optimizing intervention workflows, and designing intuitive user interfaces to streamline operations.

experience.title: Epitech
experience.description: As a regional teaching assistant at Epitech Marseille, I support students throughout their academic journey, supervise their projects, lead workshops, and act as a liaison between students and the teaching staff to ensure smooth delivery of the curriculum.

experience.title: Algorithmics
experience.description: As a Unity instructor, I introduce students aged 12 to 15 to game development and programming. I guide them through the creation of interactive 2D and 3D games using Unity, making learning fun and accessible while fostering their creativity and problem-solving skills.

experience.title: Seizen
experience.description: As Lead Developer for Seizen, I was responsible for building a game server on Nanos World, a next-generation sandbox inspired by Garry's Mod. I oversaw the implementation of gameplay features, server infrastructure, and custom game modes using Lua. I also worked with Unreal Engine and React to develop the web interface, ensuring an engaging and performant player experience.

experience.title: Seizen
experience.description: Following an initial collaboration, I rejoined Seizen as Lead Developer to relaunch the project using Unreal Engine. I lead the design of gameplay systems, multiplayer integration, network architecture, and performance optimization on both client and server sides. I also designed the projectâ€™s official website and developed a community automation tool. This experience has strengthened my full-stack development skills, technical project management abilities, and my capacity to design high-performance systems for immersive gameplay.
